results.title: Simvastatin accelerates hematoma resolution after intracerebral hemorrhage in a PPARgamma-dependent manner.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ accelerates @<m>DISEASE_Hematoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006406 @@@hematoma@@@ resolution after @DISEASE_Cerebral_Hemorrhage @DISEASE_MESH:D002543 @@@intracerebral hemorrhage@@@ in a @GENE_PPARG @GENE_25664 @@@PPARgamma@@@-dependent manner.

citations.NLM: Wang Y, Chen Q, Tan Q, Feng Z, He Z, Tang J, Feng H, Zhu G, Chen Z. Simvastatin accelerates hematoma resolution after intracerebral hemorrhage in a PPARgamma-dependent manner. Neuropharmacology. 2018 Jan;128():244-254. PMID: 29054366
citations.BibTeX: @article{29054366, title={Simvastatin accelerates hematoma resolution after intracerebral hemorrhage in a PPARgamma-dependent manner.}, author={Wang Y and Chen Q and Tan Q and Feng Z and He Z and Tang J and Feng H and Zhu G and Chen Z}, journal={Neuropharmacology}, volume={128}, pages={244-254}}

results.title: Simvastatin Promotes Hematoma Absorption and Reduces Hydrocephalus Following Intraventricular Hemorrhage in Part by Upregulating CD36.
results.text_hl: Recently, some investigations imply that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ has the ability of accelerating @<m>DISEASE_Hematoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006406 @@@hematoma@@@ absorption.

citations.NLM: Chen Q, Shi X, Tan Q, Feng Z, Wang Y, Yuan Q, Tao Y, Zhang J, Tan L, Zhu G, Feng H, Chen Z. Simvastatin Promotes Hematoma Absorption and Reduces Hydrocephalus Following Intraventricular Hemorrhage in Part by Upregulating CD36. Transl Stroke Res. 2017 Aug;8(4):362-373. PMID: 28102508
citations.BibTeX: @article{28102508, title={Simvastatin Promotes Hematoma Absorption and Reduces Hydrocephalus Following Intraventricular Hemorrhage in Part by Upregulating CD36.}, author={Chen Q and Shi X and Tan Q and Feng Z and Wang Y and Yuan Q and Tao Y and Zhang J and Tan L and Zhu G and Feng H and Chen Z}, journal={Transl Stroke Res}, volume={8}, number={4}, pages={362-373}}

results.title: Simvastatin and atorvastatin improve neurological outcome after experimental intracerebral hemorrhage.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: Initial @DISEASE_Cerebral_Hemorrhage @DISEASE_MESH:D002543 @@@ICH@@@ volumes determined by SWI were similar across all groups. @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ significantly reduced @<m>DISEASE_Hematoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006406 @@@hematoma@@@ volume at 4 weeks (P=0.002 versus control with acute volumes as baseline), whereas that for @CHEMICAL_Atorvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069059 @@@atorvastatin@@@ was marginal (P=0.09).

citations.NLM: Karki K, Knight RA, Han Y, Yang D, Zhang J, Ledbetter KA, Chopp M, Seyfried DM. Simvastatin and atorvastatin improve neurological outcome after experimental intracerebral hemorrhage. Stroke. 2009 Oct;40(10):3384-9. PMID: 19644071
citations.BibTeX: @article{19644071, title={Simvastatin and atorvastatin improve neurological outcome after experimental intracerebral hemorrhage.}, author={Karki K and Knight RA and Han Y and Yang D and Zhang J and Ledbetter KA and Chopp M and Seyfried DM}, journal={Stroke}, volume={40}, number={10}, pages={3384-9}}

results.title: Vascular recovery promoted by atorvastatin and simvastatin after experimental intracerebral hemorrhage: magnetic resonance imaging and histological study.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: Using histological indices, animals treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Atorvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069059 @@@atorvastatin@@@ had significantly increased angiogenesis and synaptogenesis in the @<m>DISEASE_Hematoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006406 @@@hematoma@@@ rim compared with the control group (p <= 0.05).

citations.NLM: Yang D, Knight RA, Han Y, Karki K, Zhang J, Ding C, Chopp M, Seyfried DM. Vascular recovery promoted by atorvastatin and simvastatin after experimental intracerebral hemorrhage: magnetic resonance imaging and histological study. J Neurosurg. 2011 Apr;114(4):1135-42. PMID: 20722611
citations.BibTeX: @article{20722611, title={Vascular recovery promoted by atorvastatin and simvastatin after experimental intracerebral hemorrhage: magnetic resonance imaging and histological study.}, author={Yang D and Knight RA and Han Y and Karki K and Zhang J and Ding C and Chopp M and Seyfried DM}, journal={J Neurosurg}, volume={114}, number={4}, pages={1135-42}}

results.title: Acute Statin Treatment Improves Recovery after Experimental Intracerebral Hemorrhage.
results.text_hl: In addition, at doses of 10 mg/kg and 20 mg/kg, histological evaluations revealed that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ or @CHEMICAL_Atorvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069059 @@@atorvastatin@@@ reduced @DISEASE_Soft_Tissue_Injuries @DISEASE_MESH:D017695 @@@tissue loss@@@, increased cell proliferation in the subventricular zone and enhanced vascular density and synaptogenesis in the @<m>DISEASE_Hematoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006406 @@@hematoma@@@ boundary zone when compared to saline-treated @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.

citations.NLM: Yang D, Zhang J, Han Y, James E, Chopp M, Seyfried DM. Acute Statin Treatment Improves Recovery after Experimental Intracerebral Hemorrhage. World J Neurosci. 2013 May;3(2):69-75. PMID: 23837132
citations.BibTeX: @article{23837132, title={Acute Statin Treatment Improves Recovery after Experimental Intracerebral Hemorrhage.}, author={Yang D and Zhang J and Han Y and James E and Chopp M and Seyfried DM}, journal={World J Neurosci}, volume={3}, number={2}, pages={69-75}}
